p: The oral mucosa is an attractive route for drug delivery since it offers a non-invasive way for drug administration and becomes an alternative route when the enteral administration is compromised [ 59]. In addition, the oral mucosa exhibits a high vascularized area that facilitates the absorption of compounds through the jugular vein that surrounds this site [ 60], hence bypassing the hepatic first pass metabolism, leading to a possible systemic effect once the active compound is in the bloodstream [ 35, 60, 61].
